put.description: Create OpenAI Account. Accounts is a resource group wide resource type. It holds the keys for developer to access intelligent APIs. It's also the resource type for billing.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The parameters to provide for the created account.

200.description: If resource is created successfully or already existed, the service should return 200 (OK).

201.description: If resource is created successfully, the service should return 201 (OK).

202.description: HTTP 202 (Accepted) if the operation was successfully started and will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The parameters to provide for the created account.

200.description: The resource provider should return 200 (OK) to indicate that the operation completed successfully.

202.description: HTTP 202 (Accepted) if the operation was successfully started and will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource group *or* resource does not exist, 404 (NotFound) should be returned.

delete.description: Deletes a OpenAI account from the resource group.

200.description: A 200 (OK) should be returned if the object exists and was deleted successfully;

202.description: HTTP 202 (Accepted) if the operation was successfully started and will complete asynchronously.

204.description: a 204 (NoContent) should be used if the resource does not exist and the request is well formed.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

get.description: Returns a OpenAI account specified by the parameters.

The resource provider should return 200 (OK) to indicate that the operation completed successfully.
For a detailed explanation of each field in the response body, please refer to the request body description in the PUT resource section. The only GET specific properties are "name," "type" and "id."
Field	Description
sku.name	Required.
	The pricing tier/plan of this API. Could be: 
	F0 - Free
	B0 - Basic
	S0 - Standard
	P0 - Premium

get.description: Returns all the resources of a particular type belonging to a resource group

200.description:
The resource provider should return 200 (OK) to indicate that the operation completed successfully. For other errors (e.g. internal errors) use the appropriate HTTP error code.
The nextLink field is expected to point to the URL the client should use to fetch the next page (per server side paging). This matches the OData guidelines for paged responses here. If a resource provider does not support paging, it should return the same body (JSON object with "value" property) but omit nextLink entirely (or set to null, *not* empty string) for future compatibility.
The nextLink should be implemented using following query parameters:
· skipToken: opaque token that allows the resource provider to skip resources already enumerated. This value is defined and returned by the RP after first request via nextLink.
· top: the optional client query parameter which defines the maximum number of records to be returned by the server.
Implementation details:
· NextLink may include all the query parameters (specifically OData $filter) used by the client in the first query. 
· Server may return less records than requested with nextLink. Returning zero records with NextLink is an acceptable response. 
Clients must fetch records until the nextLink is not returned back / null. Clients should never rely on number of returned records to determinate if pagination is completed.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource group does not exist, 404 (NotFound) will be returned.

get.description: Returns all the resources of a particular type belonging to a subscription.

200.description:
The resource provider should return 200 (OK) to indicate that the operation completed successfully. For other errors (e.g. internal errors) use the appropriate HTTP error code.
The nextLink field is expected to point to the URL the client should use to fetch the next page (per server side paging). This matches the OData guidelines for paged responses. If a resource provider does not support paging, it should return the same body but leave nextLink empty for future compatibility.
For a detailed explanation of each field in the response body, please refer to the request body description in the PUT resource section.

For a detailed explanation of each field in the response body, please refer to the request body description in the PUT resource section.

post.description: Lists the account keys for the specified OpenAI account.

200.description:
Returns with a response body containing the subscription keys for the resource: key1
The first API key for authentication when client calls the API endpoint.

key2
The second API key for authentication when client calls the API endpoint.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

post.description: Regenerates the specified account key for the specified OpenAI account.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

get.description: Gets the list of Microsoft.OpenAI SKUs available for your Subscription.

200.description: OK

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List available SKUs for the requested OpenAI account

200.description:
The resource provider should return 200 (OK) to indicate that the operation completed successfully.
For a detailed explanation of each field in the response body, please refer to the request body description in the PUT resource section. The only GET specific properties are "name," "type" and "id."
Field	Description
sku	Required, object
	The exact set of keys that define this sku. This matches the fields on the respective resource.
sku.name	Required, string
	The name of the SKU. This is typically a letter + number code, such as A0 or P3
sku.tier	Required, string
	The tier of this particular SKU. Typically one of:
	· Free
	· Basic
	· Standard
	· Premium

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource does not exist, 404 (NotFound) will be returned.

200.description: The usages for OpenAI account were retrieved successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the resource does not exist, 404 (NotFound) will be returned.

200.description: OK.

200.description: OK.

200.description: Successfully retrieved private endpoint connections.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: OK -- Get the private endpoint connection properties successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update the state of specified private endpoint connection associated with the OpenAI account.

200.description: OK -- Update the private endpoint connection properties successfully.

202.description: HTTP 202 (Accepted) if the operation was successfully started and will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified private endpoint connection associated with the OpenAI account.

200.description: OK -- Delete the private endpoint connection successfully.

202.description: Accepted -- the operation was successfully started and will complete asynchronously.

204.description: No Content -- The private endpoint connection does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the private link resources that need to be created for a OpenAI account.

200.description: Successfully retrieved private link resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

Sku.description: The resource model definition representing SKU

name.description: The name of the SKU. Ex - S0. It is typically a letter+number code

tier.description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

capacity.description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

Account.description: OpenAI account is an Azure resource representing the provisioned account, it's type, location and SKU.

sku.description: SKU properties of the of the OpenAI account.

identity.description: Managed service identity of the OpenAI account.

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of accounts.

value.description: Gets the list of OpenAI accounts and their properties.

AccountListResult.description: The list of OpenAI accounts operation response.

provisioningState.description: Gets the status of the OpenAI account at the time the operation was called.

capabilities.description: Gets the capabilities of the OpenAI account. Each item indicates the capability of a specific feature. The values are read-only and for reference only.

networkAcls.description: A collection of rules governing the accessibility from specific network locations.

encryption.description: The encryption properties for this resource.

privateEndpointConnections.description: The private endpoint connection associated with the OpenAI account.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this account. Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'

callRateLimit.description: The call rate limit for the OpenAI account.

quotaLimit.description: The quota limit for the OpenAI account.

disableLocalAuth.description: Disable local authentication, such as key based authentication.

endpoints.description: The endpoint list for the OpenAI account.

count.description: The count value of Call Rate Limit.

renewalPeriod.description: The renewal period in seconds of Call Rate Limit.

CallRateLimit.description: The call rate limit OpenAI account.

count.description: The count value of quota Limit.

renewalPeriod.description: The renewal period in seconds of quota Limit.

key.description: The rule key that uniquely identify the throttling rule.

renewalPeriod.description: The renewal period in seconds of call rate limit or quota limit.

count.description: The count value of call rate limit or quota limit.

minCount.description: The minimal count value of call rate limit or quota limit.

dynamicThrottlingEnabled.description: A flag indicates if dynamical throttling is enabled.

matchPatterns.description: The patterns for matching the requests that need to apply this rule.

RequestMatchPattern.description: The patterns for matching the requests that need to apply this rule.

ApiKeys.description: The access keys for the OpenAI account.

value.description: Gets the list of OpenAI accounts and their properties.

AccountSkuListResult.description: The list of OpenAI accounts operation response.

value.description: The list of usages for OpenAI account.

UsageListResult.description: The response to a list usage request.

name.description: The name information for the metric.

quotaPeriod.description: The quota period used to summarize the usage values.

nextResetTime.description: Next reset time for current quota.

Usage.description: The usage data for a usage request.

localizedValue.description: The friendly name of the metric.

skuAvailable.description: Indicates the given SKU is available or not.

reason.description: Reason why the SKU is not available.

SkuCapability.description: SkuCapability indicates the capability of a certain feature.

values.description: The value of restrictions. If the restriction type is set to location. This would be different locations where the SKU is restricted.

restrictionInfo.description: The information about the restriction where the SKU cannot be used.

resourceType.description: The type of resource the SKU applies to.

tier.description: Specifies the tier of OpenAI account.

locations.description: The set of locations that the SKU is available.

restrictions.description: The restrictions because of which SKU cannot be used. This is empty if there are no restrictions.

locations.description: Locations where the SKU is restricted

zones.description: List of availability zones where the SKU is restricted.

ResourceSkuRestrictionInfo.description: The restrictions because of which SKU cannot be used. This is empty if there are no restrictions.

value.description: The list of skus available for the subscription.

nextLink.description: The uri to fetch the next page of Skus.

defaultAction.description: The default action when no rule from ipRules and from virtualNetworkRules match. This is only used after the bypass property has been evaluated.

ipRules.description: The list of IP address rules.

virtualNetworkRules.description: The list of virtual network rules.

NetworkRuleSet.description: A set of rules governing the network accessibility.

value.description: An IPv4 address range in CIDR notation, such as '124.56.78.91' (simple IP address) or '124.56.78.0/24' (all addresses that start with 124.56.78).

IpRule.description: A rule governing the accessibility from a specific ip address or ip range.

id.description: Full resource id of a vnet subnet, such as '/subscriptions/subid/resourceGroups/rg1/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/test-vnet/subnets/subnet1'.

state.description: Gets the state of virtual network rule.

ignoreMissingVnetServiceEndpoint.description: Ignore missing vnet service endpoint or not.

VirtualNetworkRule.description: A rule governing the accessibility from a specific virtual network.

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.

userAssignedIdentities.description: The list of user assigned identities associated with the resource. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}

principalId.description: Azure Active Directory principal ID associated with this Identity.

clientId.description: Client App Id associated with this identity.

keySource.description: Enumerates the possible value of keySource for Encryption

keyName.description: Name of the Key from KeyVault

keyVersion.description: Version of the Key from KeyVault

identityClientId.description: The client Id of managed identity that will be used to access KeyVault secret.

PrivateEndpointConnectionListResult.description: A list of private endpoint connections

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

location.description: The location of the private endpoint connection

privateEndpoint.description: The resource of private end point.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: A collection of information about the state of the connection between service consumer and provider.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the private endpoint connection resource.

groupIds.description: The private link resource group ids.

PrivateLinkResourceListResult.description: A list of private link resources

groupId.description: The private link resource group id.

requiredMembers.description: The private link resource required member names.

requiredZoneNames.description: The private link resource Private link DNS zone name.

displayName.description: The private link resource display name.

PrivateLinkResourceProperties.description: Properties of a private link resource.

usageFilterParameter.name: $filter
usageFilterParameter.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of usages to return. The supported parameter is name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names).

privateEndpointConnectionNameParameter.name: privateEndpointConnectionName
privateEndpointConnectionNameParameter.description: The name of the private endpoint connection associated with the OpenAI Account
